intro: Erysimum longifolium proles montosicola, commonly known as the Sierra wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow linear leaves, and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its unique habitat and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with specific care requirements.
